content:
OpenFileDialogArray Class

In this Article

Provides a control array of OpenFileDialog controls.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.ProvideProperty("Index", typeof(System.Windows.Forms.OpenFileDialog))]
[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
public class OpenFileDialogArray : Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray, System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • MarshalByRefObject
  • Component
  • Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray
  • OpenFileDialogArray

Remarks

The OpenFileDialogArray class provides an equivalent for the run-time functionality of a Visual Basic 6.0 OpenFileDialog array. It does not provide the design-time features of a Visual Basic 6.0 control array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Initializes a new instance of the OpenFileDialogArray class.

Initializes a new instance of the OpenFileDialogArray class, specifying its container.

Gets a value that determines whether a control is a member of an OpenFileDialogArray.

Gets the index of an OpenFileDialog in an OpenFileDialogArray.

Overrides crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.HookUpControlEvents*.
ResetIndex(OpenFileDialog)

The ResetIndex method is not supported in the OpenFileDialogArray class.
SetIndex(OpenFileDialog,Int16)

Sets the index of the initial OpenFileDialog in an OpenFileDialogArray.
ShouldSerializeIndex(OpenFileDialog)

Returns a value that indicates whether an OpenFileDialog is a member of this OpenFileDialogArray.

Events summary

FileOk

Occurs when the user clicks on the Open or Save button on an OpenFileDialog dialog box.
HelpRequest

Occurs when the user clicks the Help button on an OpenFileDialog dialog box.

Constructors

  • OpenFileDialogArray()

    Initializes a new instance of the OpenFileDialogArray class.

    public OpenFileDialogArray ();

    Remarks

    When you instantiate an OpenFileDialogArray, you must also call the SetIndex method to create the initial element in the array.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • OpenFileDialogArray(IContainer)

    Initializes a new instance of the OpenFileDialogArray class, specifying its container.

    public OpenFileDialogArray (System.ComponentModel.IContainer Container);

    Parameters

    • Container
      IContainer

      The IContainer where the control array will be hosted.

    Remarks

    When you instantiate an OpenFileDialogArray, you must also call the SetIndex method to create the initial element in the array.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Properties

  • Item(Int16)

    Gets a specific element of an OpenFileDialogArray by index. Read-only.

    public System.Windows.Forms.OpenFileDialog this[short Index] { get; }

    Parameters

    • Index
      Int16

      A Short that specifies the position of an element of the control array.

    Property Value

    • OpenFileDialog

      An OpenFileDialog at the specified Index in the control array.

    Remarks

    The Item property is the default property for a control array. Therefore, the following lines of code are equivalent. 

    MsgBox(CStr(OpenFileDialogArray.Item(1).Text))  
MsgBox(CStr(OpenFileDialogArray(1).Text))
    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Methods

  • CanExtend(Object)

    Gets a value that determines whether a control is a member of an OpenFileDialogArray.

    public bool CanExtend (object target);

    Parameters

    • target
      Object

      An OpenFileDialog control.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if target is a member of the control array; otherwise false.

    Remarks

    The CanExtend method can be used to determine whether a specific OpenFileDialog control is the base element of the control array from which the other elements were cloned.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • GetControlInstanceType()

    Overrides crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.GetControlInstanceType*.

    protected override Type GetControlInstanceType ();

    Returns

    • Type

      The type of a control in a control array.

    Remarks

    This method cannot be called from your application's code. Use the GetType method instead.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • GetIndex(OpenFileDialog)

    Gets the index of an OpenFileDialog in an OpenFileDialogArray.

    public short GetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.OpenFileDialog o);

    Parameters

    • o
      OpenFileDialog

      An OpenFileDialog in the control array.

    Returns

    • Int16

      A Short that represents the index of the specified OpenFileDialog.

    Remarks

    This method can be used to retrieve the index for the specified OpenFileDialog.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • HookUpControlEvents(Object)

    Overrides crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.HookUpControlEvents*.

    protected override void HookUpControlEvents (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      Object

      An Object.

    Remarks

    This method cannot be called from your application's code. Use AddHandler to hook up events for any controls that are added by using the Load method.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • ResetIndex(OpenFileDialog)

    The ResetIndex method is not supported in the OpenFileDialogArray class.

    public void ResetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.OpenFileDialog o);

    Parameters

    • o
      OpenFileDialog

      A Control.

    Remarks

    This method is not supported, and calling it does not raise an exception.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • SetIndex(OpenFileDialog,Int16)

    Sets the index of the initial OpenFileDialog in an OpenFileDialogArray.

    public void SetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.OpenFileDialog o, short Index);

    Parameters

    • o
      OpenFileDialog

      An OpenFileDialog in the control array.

    • Index
      Int16

      A Short that represents the index of the specified OpenFileDialog.

    Remarks

    The SetIndex method should only be called when you are creating the initial element in the control array. To add subsequent elements, call the Load method and specify the Index.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • ShouldSerializeIndex(OpenFileDialog)

    Returns a value that indicates whether an OpenFileDialog is a member of this OpenFileDialogArray.

    public bool ShouldSerializeIndex (System.Windows.Forms.OpenFileDialog o);

    Parameters

    • o
      OpenFileDialog

      An OpenFileDialog in the control array.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if o is a member of this control array; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    If the specified OpenFileDialog is a member of a different OpenFileDialogArray, ShouldSerializeIndex returns false.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

    Occurs when the user clicks on the Open or Save button on an OpenFileDialog dialog box.

    public event System.ComponentModel.CancelEventHandler FileOk;

    For more information about how to handle events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

  • HelpRequest

    Occurs when the user clicks the Help button on an OpenFileDialog dialog box.

    public event EventHandler HelpRequest;

    Remarks

    For more information about how to handle events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

    Note

    Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
